definitions: covered with or containing blood from injury or violence
involving or characterized by bloodshed, violence, or killing
used informally as an intensifier to express anger or emphasis
examples: His bloody hands showed evidence of the fight
The bloody bandage needed to be changed immediately
The bloody battle lasted for three days
They witnessed a bloody revolution in their country
That bloody car won't start again this morning
It's bloody cold outside today

definitions: producing or having flowers; in the state of flowering
thriving, flourishing, or showing healthy vigor and freshness
used as a mild intensifier or euphemism for stronger language
examples: The blooming roses filled the garden with fragrance
Spring brings blooming flowers to the countryside
Her blooming complexion showed good health and vitality
The blooming business attracted many investors
It's a blooming miracle that we arrived on time
That blooming dog keeps barking all night

definitions: marked or covered with irregular patches or spots of color or stains
examples: His blotched skin showed signs of the allergic reaction
The blotched leaves indicated plant disease

definitions: moved, carried, or affected by wind or air current
inflated, expanded, or swollen with air or gas
ruined, exposed, or no longer secret as in a cover being blown
examples: The blown leaves covered the entire driveway
Her blown hair obscured her face in the photo
The blown balloon floated toward the ceiling
The blown glass vase was beautifully crafted
Their blown cover forced them to abandon the mission
The blown opportunity haunted him for years

definitions: having the color of the clear sky or deep sea
feeling or showing sadness, melancholy, or depression
containing or characterized by risqué, indecent, or profane content
examples: The blue ocean stretched to the horizon
She wore a beautiful blue dress to the party
He felt blue after hearing the sad news
Don't look so blue; things will get better soon
The comedian's blue jokes offended some audience members
That movie has some pretty blue language

definitions: having a broad, steep front or cliff-like appearance
direct, frank, and hearty in manner without subtlety or delicacy
examples: The bluff cliffs rose dramatically from the sea
They built their house on the bluff hillside
His bluff manner sometimes offended sensitive people
The bluff sailor spoke his mind without hesitation

definitions: having a slight blue color or tinge; somewhat blue
examples: The bruise had a bluish purple color
Her lips looked bluish in the cold weather

definitions: having a dull edge or point; not sharp or pointed
speaking in a direct, frank manner without trying to be polite
examples: The blunt knife couldn't cut through the rope
He hit his head on the blunt corner of the table
Her blunt criticism hurt his feelings deeply
I appreciate your blunt honesty about the situation

definitions: made dull or less sharp through use or damage
reduced in force, intensity, or effectiveness; weakened or dulled
examples: The blunted pencil needed sharpening before use
Years of use had blunted the kitchen knives
His blunted emotions made him seem indifferent
The drug blunted their response to pain

definitions: not clear or sharp to the sight; out of focus
lacking clear definition or boundaries; vague or indistinct
examples: The blurred photograph was taken while moving
His vision became blurred without his glasses
The blurred line between right and wrong troubled her
Their blurred memories of childhood were unreliable

definitions: not clear or distinct to the sight; lacking sharp definition or focus
examples: The blurry picture needed better focusing
Everything looked blurry after the eye drops

definitions: showing redness in the face from embarrassment, shame, or modesty
examples: The blushing bride walked down the aisle slowly
His blushing face revealed his embarrassment

definitions: showing excessive pride in oneself or one's achievements; given to bragging
examples: His boastful nature made him unpopular with colleagues
She gave a boastful account of her accomplishments

definitions: having a tail that has been cut short or is naturally short
examples: The bobtail cat was born with a naturally short tail
Several bobtail breeds are popular as pets

definitions: having a body of a specified kind, used in combination with other words
examples: The full-bodied wine had rich, complex flavors
These able-bodied workers can handle heavy lifting

definitions: relating to or affecting the human body as opposed to the mind
examples: The accident caused serious bodily harm to the victim
Regular exercise promotes bodily health and fitness

definitions: wet and spongy like a bog; marshy and yielding underfoot
examples: The boggy ground made walking extremely difficult
They avoided the boggy areas near the swamp

definitions: not genuine or authentic; fake, fraudulent, or counterfeit
examples: The police discovered bogus currency in his possession
She gave a bogus excuse for missing work

definitions: socially unconventional in an artistic way; having informal artistic interests
examples: The bohemian lifestyle attracted many young artists
She decorated her apartment in bohemian style

definitions: cooked by immersion in boiling water or other liquid
examples: She served boiled eggs for breakfast every morning
The boiled vegetables retained their nutritional value

definitions: noisy, energetic, and cheerful in a way that lacks restraint
examples: The boisterous children played loudly in the yard
Their boisterous laughter filled the entire restaurant

definitions: showing courage and confidence; willing to take risks
having a strong, vivid, or clear appearance; standing out prominently
examples: Her bold decision to start a business paid off
The bold explorer ventured into unknown territory
The bold colors made the painting stand out
She wore bold red lipstick to the event

definitions: using high-sounding but meaningless language; pompous and pretentious in speech
examples: His bombastic speech failed to impress the audience
The politician's bombastic rhetoric masked his lack of substance

definitions: made of or relating to bone material from skeletal structures
examples: The museum displayed ancient bone tools and weapons
She wore an elegant bone china tea set

definitions: having had the bones removed, especially from meat or fish
examples: The recipe calls for boned chicken breasts
She preferred boned fish to avoid choking hazards

definitions: having no bones or having had the bones removed
examples: Boneless chicken wings are easier for children to eat
The boneless fish fillets cooked quickly

definitions: completely mad or crazy; wildly excited or enthusiastic
examples: That bonkers idea might actually work somehow
The crowd went bonkers when their team won

definitions: attractive, beautiful, or healthy-looking, especially used in Scottish dialect
examples: The bonnie lass sang traditional Scottish songs
What a bonnie baby you have there

definitions: attractive, beautiful, or healthy-looking, especially used in Scottish and Northern English
examples: She was a bonny child with rosy cheeks
The bonny countryside looked beautiful in spring

definitions: very thin so that bones are prominent or visible
containing many bones or made of bone material
examples: His bony fingers gripped the walking stick tightly
The bony horse looked underfed and neglected
The bony fish was difficult to eat
This bony cut of meat requires slow cooking

definitions: able to be reserved or arranged in advance through booking
examples: All seats for the concert are bookable online
The hotel rooms are bookable six months ahead

definitions: reserved or arranged in advance through a booking system
having all available time scheduled; completely busy with appointments
examples: The restaurant is fully booked for tonight
All flights are booked until next week
I'm completely booked this afternoon with meetings
The doctor is booked solid for two weeks

definitions: devoted to reading and studying rather than practical activities
examples: The bookish child preferred libraries to playgrounds
His bookish nature made him an excellent researcher

definitions: making a loud, deep, resonant sound
experiencing rapid growth, expansion, or economic success
examples: His booming voice could be heard across the hall
The booming thunder frightened the children
The booming economy created many new jobs
Business was booming after the new product launch

definitions: beneficial, helpful, or advantageous; serving as a blessing
examples: The new highway proved a boon companion for travelers
These boon times brought prosperity to everyone

definitions: wearing boots on the feet; equipped with boots
examples: The booted soldiers marched through the muddy field
Booted riders prepared for the long journey

definitions: illegally made, distributed, or sold, especially recordings or alcohol
examples: Police confiscated thousands of bootleg DVDs yesterday
The bootleg whiskey was sold during Prohibition

definitions: having an edge, boundary, or decorative border around something
examples: The bordered garden path looked neat and organized
She wore a bordered shawl with intricate patterns

definitions: barely acceptable or barely reaching a standard; on the edge between categories
examples: His borderline grades worried his parents greatly
That joke was borderline offensive to some people

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the north or northern regions
examples: The boreal forest stretches across northern Canada
Boreal climates experience long, cold winters

definitions: feeling weary and impatient because of lack of interest or stimulation
examples: The bored students stared out the window
She felt bored during the long lecture

definitions: not interesting or exciting; causing feelings of weariness and restlessness
examples: The boring movie put half the audience to sleep
He found the boring job unbearable after a month

definitions: brought into life or existence through birth
having a natural talent or inclination from birth; innate
examples: She was born in Paris during the spring
The born child was healthy and strong
He's a born leader with natural charisma
She's a born teacher who loves helping others

definitions: fond of giving orders in a domineering way; overly authoritative
examples: Her bossy attitude alienated her coworkers
The bossy child always told others what to do

definitions: relating to plants or the scientific study of plants
examples: They visited the botanic garden every spring
His botanic knowledge impressed the other researchers

definitions: relating to plants or botany; connected with the scientific study of plants
examples: The botanical illustrations were scientifically accurate
She studied botanical medicine at the university

definitions: carried out badly or carelessly; bungled or ruined through incompetence
examples: The botched surgery left permanent damage
His botched attempt at repair made things worse

definitions: feeling troubled, worried, or annoyed about something
examples: She seemed bothered by the constant noise
He was too bothered to concentrate on work

definitions: situated at the lowest position or rank; at the base or foundation
examples: The bottom shelf held the heaviest books
He started at the bottom rung of the company

definitions: having a bottom of a specified type, used in combinations
examples: The flat-bottomed boat was stable in shallow water
Round-bottomed flasks are used in chemistry labs
